alert.note: Alert for Clay; Coosa; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:09PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Tallapoosa, northeastern Coosa and south central Clay Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 208 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bradford, or over Goodwater, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Goodwater, Kellyton, New Site, Goldville, Hillabee Creek, Bradford, Parkdale, Hatchet, Crewsville, Northern Lake Martin, Cleveland Crossroads, Horseshoe Bend National Military Park, Hackneyville, Eagle Creek and Horseshoe Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
